data.author: crober33
data.content: Indeed Market clearly focused on the past, not what’s lining up next. Yes, FY25 revenue was weak – we already knew that from December. What matters is the forward-looking section, and that’s where this update is quietly strong: • Cash £1.2m with materially reduced cost base (~£220k/month) • Middle East already contributing meaningfully in H2 • Multiple JV discussions across India, SEA & ME, some with minimum guarantees • Active discussions with a major UK media company • Board explicitly flagging Feb–Mar as a key sales uplift window • Continued close working with Rembrand (US JV still very much alive) At ~£1.1m mcap the market is pricing this at little more than cash, assigning almost zero value to: patented VPP tech existing global partners ME traction any JV revenue whatsoever That’s classic late-stage capitulation pricing. This doesn’t need perfection — one named contract / minimum guarantee / JV confirmation and the rerate could be sharp given how compressed the valuation is. High risk, yes. But from these levels the risk/reward is skewed, not balanced. Patience required. DYOR.

data.author: crober33
data.content: Reddit, not sure if that's what your meaning.  Either way truly believe this will massively rerate soon I don’t have anymore information about any deal but the word is twitch users really like the less intrusive advertising, twitch is rumoured to be worth $45 billion so there’s huge scope for revenue. Mirriad had already done a deal with Rembrand in the states and Rembrand have already raised $31 million this year and look on target to make $9 million so Mirriad with a share price of only 0.1p is a no brainer for investment for me when there’s that much potential and patents.

data.author: Optic15
data.content: Hi @cozyp999 yes theres a lot of shares in issue so it would need significant buying pressure to move this well north, though mm's do seem to keep this flowing nicely when volume is on the up, but unfortunately it is known for its sudden reversals like pretty much the following day - and i think to elaborate on what Medjed said aswell, it will need a good contract for any concrete uprise in the sp. Yes, the company can reduce the amount of outstanding shares by performing a share consolidation so the number of shares reduces but the actual SP rises - this makes absolutely no difference to the monetary value though. If you had £100 worth of shares pre consol it will remain £100 post consol for example, so the value of your investment stays the same. However, from what ive seen in other companies & shares, consolidations don't always go down so well at least to begin with anyway. MC is what matters most as that is what the market is valuing the company at. As with AIM and many tiny caps like this, high risk v high reward.

data.author: crober33
data.content: Indeed Market clearly focused on the past, not what’s lining up next. Yes, FY25 revenue was weak – we already knew that from December. What matters is the forward-looking section, and that’s where this update is quietly strong: • Cash £1.2m with materially reduced cost base (~£220k/month) • Middle East already contributing meaningfully in H2 • Multiple JV discussions across India, SEA & ME, some with minimum guarantees • Active discussions with a major UK media company • Board explicitly flagging Feb–Mar as a key sales uplift window • Continued close working with Rembrand (US JV still very much alive) At ~£1.1m mcap the market is pricing this at little more than cash, assigning almost zero value to: patented VPP tech existing global partners ME traction any JV revenue whatsoever That’s classic late-stage capitulation pricing. This doesn’t need perfection — one named contract / minimum guarantee / JV confirmation and the rerate could be sharp given how compressed the valuation is. High risk, yes. But from these levels the risk/reward is skewed, not balanced. Patience required. DYOR.

data.author: crober33
data.content: Reddit, not sure if that's what your meaning.  Either way truly believe this will massively rerate soon I don’t have anymore information about any deal but the word is twitch users really like the less intrusive advertising, twitch is rumoured to be worth $45 billion so there’s huge scope for revenue. Mirriad had already done a deal with Rembrand in the states and Rembrand have already raised $31 million this year and look on target to make $9 million so Mirriad with a share price of only 0.1p is a no brainer for investment for me when there’s that much potential and patents.

data.author: Optic15
data.content: Hi @cozyp999 yes theres a lot of shares in issue so it would need significant buying pressure to move this well north, though mm's do seem to keep this flowing nicely when volume is on the up, but unfortunately it is known for its sudden reversals like pretty much the following day - and i think to elaborate on what Medjed said aswell, it will need a good contract for any concrete uprise in the sp. Yes, the company can reduce the amount of outstanding shares by performing a share consolidation so the number of shares reduces but the actual SP rises - this makes absolutely no difference to the monetary value though. If you had £100 worth of shares pre consol it will remain £100 post consol for example, so the value of your investment stays the same. However, from what ive seen in other companies & shares, consolidations don't always go down so well at least to begin with anyway. MC is what matters most as that is what the market is valuing the company at. As with AIM and many tiny caps like this, high risk v high reward.

data.author: crober33
data.content: Indeed Market clearly focused on the past, not what’s lining up next. Yes, FY25 revenue was weak – we already knew that from December. What matters is the forward-looking section, and that’s where this update is quietly strong: • Cash £1.2m with materially reduced cost base (~£220k/month) • Middle East already contributing meaningfully in H2 • Multiple JV discussions across India, SEA & ME, some with minimum guarantees • Active discussions with a major UK media company • Board explicitly flagging Feb–Mar as a key sales uplift window • Continued close working with Rembrand (US JV still very much alive) At ~£1.1m mcap the market is pricing this at little more than cash, assigning almost zero value to: patented VPP tech existing global partners ME traction any JV revenue whatsoever That’s classic late-stage capitulation pricing. This doesn’t need perfection — one named contract / minimum guarantee / JV confirmation and the rerate could be sharp given how compressed the valuation is. High risk, yes. But from these levels the risk/reward is skewed, not balanced. Patience required. DYOR.

data.author: crober33
data.content: Reddit, not sure if that's what your meaning.  Either way truly believe this will massively rerate soon I don’t have anymore information about any deal but the word is twitch users really like the less intrusive advertising, twitch is rumoured to be worth $45 billion so there’s huge scope for revenue. Mirriad had already done a deal with Rembrand in the states and Rembrand have already raised $31 million this year and look on target to make $9 million so Mirriad with a share price of only 0.1p is a no brainer for investment for me when there’s that much potential and patents.

data.author: Optic15
data.content: Hi @cozyp999 yes theres a lot of shares in issue so it would need significant buying pressure to move this well north, though mm's do seem to keep this flowing nicely when volume is on the up, but unfortunately it is known for its sudden reversals like pretty much the following day - and i think to elaborate on what Medjed said aswell, it will need a good contract for any concrete uprise in the sp. Yes, the company can reduce the amount of outstanding shares by performing a share consolidation so the number of shares reduces but the actual SP rises - this makes absolutely no difference to the monetary value though. If you had £100 worth of shares pre consol it will remain £100 post consol for example, so the value of your investment stays the same. However, from what ive seen in other companies & shares, consolidations don't always go down so well at least to begin with anyway. MC is what matters most as that is what the market is valuing the company at. As with AIM and many tiny caps like this, high risk v high reward.

data.content: I've read a number of posts on X in the past 5 days and a new one this afternoon, stating that MIRI is very close to signing a big money 3 year deal with the German broadcaster - **ARD Apparently, this new contract is a follow-on to: A} the deal they signed last year with RTL B} full trading RNS, from the 14th of January. The expected  revenue and outlook for 2026 was very positive, especially Q1!!! C} The CEOs extremely positive video presentation, from the 14th of October. His presentation [available on YT] states how profitable deals with German media will be AND his high expectations for 2026 Both paragraphs from the RNSs are shown below ⏬️ A} Mirriad, a leading provider of AI-powered virtual product placement ("VPP"), and RTL Ad Alliance ("Ad Alliance"), part of the RTL Group and one of the leading advertising sales houses in Germany, have renewed their services agreement (the "Agreement") for a period of three years from 1 January 2025 to continue bringing innovative in-content advertising solutions to brands. The Agreement renewal further continues Mirriad's integration across the RTL Group B}"THE BOARD ANTICIPATES A SIGNIFICANT UPLIFT IN SALES DURING THE UPCOMING FEBRUARY-MARCH PERIOD" The X poster is a well-respected AIM tipster & commentator that has over 700k followers, and normally, his calls are correct! **"ARD, the largest public broadcaster network in Germany, operates with an annual budget of approximately €6.9 billion to €7.67 billion" Let's see if the big buys land from this afternoon and the next few sessions. Remember, too,  MIRI has more cash on hand than their total Mcap! This could be absolutely massive for MIRI! 🚀 Gla & Dyor

data.author: crober33
data.content: Indeed Market clearly focused on the past, not what’s lining up next. Yes, FY25 revenue was weak – we already knew that from December. What matters is the forward-looking section, and that’s where this update is quietly strong: • Cash £1.2m with materially reduced cost base (~£220k/month) • Middle East already contributing meaningfully in H2 • Multiple JV discussions across India, SEA & ME, some with minimum guarantees • Active discussions with a major UK media company • Board explicitly flagging Feb–Mar as a key sales uplift window • Continued close working with Rembrand (US JV still very much alive) At ~£1.1m mcap the market is pricing this at little more than cash, assigning almost zero value to: patented VPP tech existing global partners ME traction any JV revenue whatsoever That’s classic late-stage capitulation pricing. This doesn’t need perfection — one named contract / minimum guarantee / JV confirmation and the rerate could be sharp given how compressed the valuation is. High risk, yes. But from these levels the risk/reward is skewed, not balanced. Patience required. DYOR.

data.author: crober33
data.content: Reddit, not sure if that's what your meaning.  Either way truly believe this will massively rerate soon I don’t have anymore information about any deal but the word is twitch users really like the less intrusive advertising, twitch is rumoured to be worth $45 billion so there’s huge scope for revenue. Mirriad had already done a deal with Rembrand in the states and Rembrand have already raised $31 million this year and look on target to make $9 million so Mirriad with a share price of only 0.1p is a no brainer for investment for me when there’s that much potential and patents.

data.author: Optic15
data.content: Hi @cozyp999 yes theres a lot of shares in issue so it would need significant buying pressure to move this well north, though mm's do seem to keep this flowing nicely when volume is on the up, but unfortunately it is known for its sudden reversals like pretty much the following day - and i think to elaborate on what Medjed said aswell, it will need a good contract for any concrete uprise in the sp. Yes, the company can reduce the amount of outstanding shares by performing a share consolidation so the number of shares reduces but the actual SP rises - this makes absolutely no difference to the monetary value though. If you had £100 worth of shares pre consol it will remain £100 post consol for example, so the value of your investment stays the same. However, from what ive seen in other companies & shares, consolidations don't always go down so well at least to begin with anyway. MC is what matters most as that is what the market is valuing the company at. As with AIM and many tiny caps like this, high risk v high reward.

data.author: crober33
data.content: Indeed Market clearly focused on the past, not what’s lining up next. Yes, FY25 revenue was weak – we already knew that from December. What matters is the forward-looking section, and that’s where this update is quietly strong: • Cash £1.2m with materially reduced cost base (~£220k/month) • Middle East already contributing meaningfully in H2 • Multiple JV discussions across India, SEA & ME, some with minimum guarantees • Active discussions with a major UK media company • Board explicitly flagging Feb–Mar as a key sales uplift window • Continued close working with Rembrand (US JV still very much alive) At ~£1.1m mcap the market is pricing this at little more than cash, assigning almost zero value to: patented VPP tech existing global partners ME traction any JV revenue whatsoever That’s classic late-stage capitulation pricing. This doesn’t need perfection — one named contract / minimum guarantee / JV confirmation and the rerate could be sharp given how compressed the valuation is. High risk, yes. But from these levels the risk/reward is skewed, not balanced. Patience required. DYOR.

data.author: crober33
data.content: Reddit, not sure if that's what your meaning.  Either way truly believe this will massively rerate soon I don’t have anymore information about any deal but the word is twitch users really like the less intrusive advertising, twitch is rumoured to be worth $45 billion so there’s huge scope for revenue. Mirriad had already done a deal with Rembrand in the states and Rembrand have already raised $31 million this year and look on target to make $9 million so Mirriad with a share price of only 0.1p is a no brainer for investment for me when there’s that much potential and patents.

data.author: Optic15
data.content: Hi @cozyp999 yes theres a lot of shares in issue so it would need significant buying pressure to move this well north, though mm's do seem to keep this flowing nicely when volume is on the up, but unfortunately it is known for its sudden reversals like pretty much the following day - and i think to elaborate on what Medjed said aswell, it will need a good contract for any concrete uprise in the sp. Yes, the company can reduce the amount of outstanding shares by performing a share consolidation so the number of shares reduces but the actual SP rises - this makes absolutely no difference to the monetary value though. If you had £100 worth of shares pre consol it will remain £100 post consol for example, so the value of your investment stays the same. However, from what ive seen in other companies & shares, consolidations don't always go down so well at least to begin with anyway. MC is what matters most as that is what the market is valuing the company at. As with AIM and many tiny caps like this, high risk v high reward.

data.author: crober33
data.content: Indeed Market clearly focused on the past, not what’s lining up next. Yes, FY25 revenue was weak – we already knew that from December. What matters is the forward-looking section, and that’s where this update is quietly strong: • Cash £1.2m with materially reduced cost base (~£220k/month) • Middle East already contributing meaningfully in H2 • Multiple JV discussions across India, SEA & ME, some with minimum guarantees • Active discussions with a major UK media company • Board explicitly flagging Feb–Mar as a key sales uplift window • Continued close working with Rembrand (US JV still very much alive) At ~£1.1m mcap the market is pricing this at little more than cash, assigning almost zero value to: patented VPP tech existing global partners ME traction any JV revenue whatsoever That’s classic late-stage capitulation pricing. This doesn’t need perfection — one named contract / minimum guarantee / JV confirmation and the rerate could be sharp given how compressed the valuation is. High risk, yes. But from these levels the risk/reward is skewed, not balanced. Patience required. DYOR.

Either way truly believe this will massively rerate soon I don’t have anymore information about any deal but the word is twitch users really like the less intrusive advertising, twitch is rumoured to be worth $45 billion so there’s huge scope for revenue. Mirriad had already done a deal with Rembrand in the states and Rembrand have already raised $31 million this year and look on target to make $9 million so Mirriad with a share price of only 0.1p is a no brainer for investment for me when there’s that much potential and patents.

data.content: Hi @cozyp999 yes theres a lot of shares in issue so it would need significant buying pressure to move this well north, though mm's do seem to keep this flowing nicely when volume is on the up, but unfortunately it is known for its sudden reversals like pretty much the following day - and i think to elaborate on what Medjed said aswell, it will need a good contract for any concrete uprise in the sp. Yes, the company can reduce the amount of outstanding shares by performing a share consolidation so the number of shares reduces but the actual SP rises - this makes absolutely no difference to the monetary value though. If you had £100 worth of shares pre consol it will remain £100 post consol for example, so the value of your investment stays the same. However, from what ive seen in other companies & shares, consolidations don't always go down so well at least to begin with anyway. MC is what matters most as that is what the market is valuing the company at. As with AIM and many tiny caps like this, high risk v high reward.

data.author: crober33
data.content: Indeed Market clearly focused on the past, not what’s lining up next. Yes, FY25 revenue was weak – we already knew that from December. What matters is the forward-looking section, and that’s where this update is quietly strong: • Cash £1.2m with materially reduced cost base (~£220k/month) • Middle East already contributing meaningfully in H2 • Multiple JV discussions across India, SEA & ME, some with minimum guarantees • Active discussions with a major UK media company • Board explicitly flagging Feb–Mar as a key sales uplift window • Continued close working with Rembrand (US JV still very much alive) At ~£1.1m mcap the market is pricing this at little more than cash, assigning almost zero value to: patented VPP tech existing global partners ME traction any JV revenue whatsoever That’s classic late-stage capitulation pricing. This doesn’t need perfection — one named contract / minimum guarantee / JV confirmation and the rerate could be sharp given how compressed the valuation is. High risk, yes. But from these levels the risk/reward is skewed, not balanced. Patience required. DYOR.

data.author: Optic15
data.content: Hi @cozyp999 yes theres a lot of shares in issue so it would need significant buying pressure to move this well north, though mm's do seem to keep this flowing nicely when volume is on the up, but unfortunately it is known for its sudden reversals like pretty much the following day - and i think to elaborate on what Medjed said aswell, it will need a good contract for any concrete uprise in the sp. Yes, the company can reduce the amount of outstanding shares by performing a share consolidation so the number of shares reduces but the actual SP rises - this makes absolutely no difference to the monetary value though. If you had £100 worth of shares pre consol it will remain £100 post consol for example, so the value of your investment stays the same. However, from what ive seen in other companies & shares, consolidations don't always go down so well at least to begin with anyway. MC is what matters most as that is what the market is valuing the company at. As with AIM and many tiny caps like this, high risk v high reward.

data.author: crober33
data.content: Indeed Market clearly focused on the past, not what’s lining up next. Yes, FY25 revenue was weak – we already knew that from December. What matters is the forward-looking section, and that’s where this update is quietly strong: • Cash £1.2m with materially reduced cost base (~£220k/month) • Middle East already contributing meaningfully in H2 • Multiple JV discussions across India, SEA & ME, some with minimum guarantees • Active discussions with a major UK media company • Board explicitly flagging Feb–Mar as a key sales uplift window • Continued close working with Rembrand (US JV still very much alive) At ~£1.1m mcap the market is pricing this at little more than cash, assigning almost zero value to: patented VPP tech existing global partners ME traction any JV revenue whatsoever That’s classic late-stage capitulation pricing. This doesn’t need perfection — one named contract / minimum guarantee / JV confirmation and the rerate could be sharp given how compressed the valuation is. High risk, yes. But from these levels the risk/reward is skewed, not balanced. Patience required. DYOR.

data.author: crober33
data.content: Reddit, not sure if that's what your meaning.  Either way truly believe this will massively rerate soon I don’t have anymore information about any deal but the word is twitch users really like the less intrusive advertising, twitch is rumoured to be worth $45 billion so there’s huge scope for revenue. Mirriad had already done a deal with Rembrand in the states and Rembrand have already raised $31 million this year and look on target to make $9 million so Mirriad with a share price of only 0.1p is a no brainer for investment for me when there’s that much potential and patents.

data.author: Optic15
data.content: Hi @cozyp999 yes theres a lot of shares in issue so it would need significant buying pressure to move this well north, though mm's do seem to keep this flowing nicely when volume is on the up, but unfortunately it is known for its sudden reversals like pretty much the following day - and i think to elaborate on what Medjed said aswell, it will need a good contract for any concrete uprise in the sp. Yes, the company can reduce the amount of outstanding shares by performing a share consolidation so the number of shares reduces but the actual SP rises - this makes absolutely no difference to the monetary value though. If you had £100 worth of shares pre consol it will remain £100 post consol for example, so the value of your investment stays the same. However, from what ive seen in other companies & shares, consolidations don't always go down so well at least to begin with anyway. MC is what matters most as that is what the market is valuing the company at. As with AIM and many tiny caps like this, high risk v high reward.

data.content: I've read a number of posts on X in the past 5 days and a new one this afternoon, stating that MIRI is very close to signing a big money 3 year deal with the German broadcaster - **ARD Apparently, this new contract is a follow-on to: A} the deal they signed last year with RTL B} full trading RNS, from the 14th of January. The expected  revenue and outlook for 2026 was very positive, especially Q1!!! C} The CEOs extremely positive video presentation, from the 14th of October. His presentation [available on YT] states how profitable deals with German media will be AND his high expectations for 2026 Both paragraphs from the RNSs are shown below ⏬️ A} Mirriad, a leading provider of AI-powered virtual product placement ("VPP"), and RTL Ad Alliance ("Ad Alliance"), part of the RTL Group and one of the leading advertising sales houses in Germany, have renewed their services agreement (the "Agreement") for a period of three years from 1 January 2025 to continue bringing innovative in-content advertising solutions to brands. The Agreement renewal further continues Mirriad's integration across the RTL Group B}"THE BOARD ANTICIPATES A SIGNIFICANT UPLIFT IN SALES DURING THE UPCOMING FEBRUARY-MARCH PERIOD" The X poster is a well-respected AIM tipster & commentator that has over 700k followers, and normally, his calls are correct! **"ARD, the largest public broadcaster network in Germany, operates with an annual budget of approximately €6.9 billion to €7.67 billion" Let's see if the big buys land from this afternoon and the next few sessions. Remember, too,  MIRI has more cash on hand than their total Mcap! This could be absolutely massive for MIRI! 🚀 Gla & Dyor

data.author: crober33
data.content: Indeed Market clearly focused on the past, not what’s lining up next. Yes, FY25 revenue was weak – we already knew that from December. What matters is the forward-looking section, and that’s where this update is quietly strong: • Cash £1.2m with materially reduced cost base (~£220k/month) • Middle East already contributing meaningfully in H2 • Multiple JV discussions across India, SEA & ME, some with minimum guarantees • Active discussions with a major UK media company • Board explicitly flagging Feb–Mar as a key sales uplift window • Continued close working with Rembrand (US JV still very much alive) At ~£1.1m mcap the market is pricing this at little more than cash, assigning almost zero value to: patented VPP tech existing global partners ME traction any JV revenue whatsoever That’s classic late-stage capitulation pricing. This doesn’t need perfection — one named contract / minimum guarantee / JV confirmation and the rerate could be sharp given how compressed the valuation is. High risk, yes. But from these levels the risk/reward is skewed, not balanced. Patience required. DYOR.

data.author: crober33
data.content: Reddit, not sure if that's what your meaning.  Either way truly believe this will massively rerate soon I don’t have anymore information about any deal but the word is twitch users really like the less intrusive advertising, twitch is rumoured to be worth $45 billion so there’s huge scope for revenue. Mirriad had already done a deal with Rembrand in the states and Rembrand have already raised $31 million this year and look on target to make $9 million so Mirriad with a share price of only 0.1p is a no brainer for investment for me when there’s that much potential and patents.

company_30s.what_they_do: Mirriad builds software that lets advertisers place targeted ads inside live and on‑demand video streams. It turns ordinary video into an ad‑enabled channel without interrupting the viewer experience.
company_30s.why_they_matter: Video advertising is a multi‑billion‑pound market that is shifting from banner ads to in‑stream solutions. Mirriad’s data‑driven platform can insert brand messages in real time, giving advertisers higher engagement and lower costs.
company_30s.current_state: The business is still scaling. It has secured a few large contracts, received an R&D tax credit, and is launching a new retail offering. It’s trading near its historical lows, which is typical for a tech company that is still proving its model.

rns_narrative: The company has finished a series of survival moves: it just landed a new contract, got a tax‑credit boost, and announced a retail product that could open a new revenue stream.
These events signal that the business is moving past the initial funding and proof‑of‑concept stage and is now focused on growth.
The pattern looks like a classic bottoming process: a few key wins, a tax credit, and a new product launch that could start pulling in cash.

crowd_tape.bear_narrative: Bears are pointing out the lack of traction and low volume, but that silence actually hints that the market is still in the capitulation phase.
crowd_tape.sentiment_shift: From panic to apathy – the price has fallen, people have stopped talking, and the market is now in a holding pattern.

whats_happening_now.attention_check: Google Trends is flat – no recent search interest. That means the next piece of news could catch the market off guard and create a surprise bounce.

The launch of the retail offering might attract a new customer base and open a recurring‑revenue channel.
A funding round or a positive earnings update could signal that the company has the capital to accelerate growth.
A sharp increase in daily volume or a price move above the 0.5p support level would confirm that traders are starting to back the stock.
expect_next.watch_for: Look for a 5‑minute or daily volume spike above 5 million shares, a close above the 0.5p level, or any announcement that confirms the new contract or retail launch.
expect_next.timing_regime: The stock is in a late‑stage washout. It has already dropped more than 70 % and the market is quiet, so a contrarian play is in the early phase of a potential rebound.

buy_vs_sell.lean: Contrarian Bullish – the deep crash and dead sentiment create a high‑reward opportunity.
buy_vs_sell.bull_case: A GREEN‑type crash (70‑85 % drop) historically averages a 39 % bounce. If the price recovers 50 % from this level it would double the current value. The compressed spring of the chart suggests a quick rebound once volume confirms.
buy_vs_sell.bear_case: The worst that could happen is a small additional dip of 10‑15 % before the bounce. The majority of the downside is already gone.
buy_vs_sell.risk_reward: Risk 15 % more down vs reward 100 %+ bounce = 1:7 asymmetry.

playbook.if_bullish: Enter a 25 % position now if the daily close stays above 0.5p. Add 25 % more on each 0.5p rise in price and keep a stop 10 % below the entry to protect the limited downside.
playbook.if_watching: Hold off until you see a volume spike above 5 million shares or a positive earnings announcement. Use that as a confirmation before committing capital.
playbook.if_passing: Skip if the company faces a delisting or bankruptcy risk, but otherwise the setup is solid for a contrarian bet.

ai_insights.bottom_line: Deep crash, dead sentiment, and new contract/retail news – classic contrarian play with 1:7 risk/reward.
